ygData.subject: RE: Twinked Bards Re: Blackened Iron (meta)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Definitely.  Where I start to see wrong is when one person s fun starts to detract from another s. ... That s another thing I don t understand.  The extent
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 22 Jul 1999, James Schuldes wrote:
>
> Having fun in this game depends first and foremost on YOU! I admit before I

Definitely. Where I start to see wrong is when one person's
fun starts to detract from another's.

> knew much, I was very indignent about other char I would see who I thought
> do not "deserve" to wear that armor (too good armor for low lev char) But
> truthfully, I did not understand the game well. Now - all I can say is -
> make it fun for you. Don't hate others because you don't think something is
> "right" about how they play the game. It won't help you have more fun.

That's another thing I don't understand. The extent to which
you can give someone grief in this game (aside from kill
stealing and training, which are bannable) is withholding
help. If someone decides not to help you because they think
you're twinked, how can you complain? He was never under any
obligation to help you in the first place.

> Remember - if it can be done, it will be done. You may think Verant should
> put in some limits on what level can have such and such stuffs. But where
> is the fun in that? Much of the crazy things that happen - happen because
> there are so few rules.

Well, personally, I think the entire level based system is
flawed... :-)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
